# Chord: add4 in C (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The add4 chord is a variation where the fourth note of the scale is added to the chord. In the key of C, played using the shape of a G chord, this means adding the F note to the triad formed by G-B-D. This chord adds a unique color and tension to the traditional major chord.

## Notes and Intervals
- G (root)
- B (major third)
- D (perfect fifth)
- F (added fourth)

- Intervals:
  - G to B (Major Third)
  - G to D (Perfect Fifth)
  - G to F (Added Fourth)
  - B to F (Minor Seventh)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The add4 chord in C, using the shape of a G chord, is commonly found in genres like folk, indie, and singer-songwriter music. This chord gives a dreamy and ethereal quality to the music due to the added fourth note. It can convey emotions like contemplation, nostalgia, or even a sense of wonder depending on the context in which it is used.

## Songs
Three songs that use the add4 chord in C with the shape of a G chord include:
1. "Babylon" by David Gray
2. "Yellow" by Coldplay
3. "Fast Car" by Tracy Chapman
